intro: Bryanthus, commonly known as the common bryanthus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and have a distinctive appearance with small, clustered flowers. They are often found in temperate regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Bryanthus species are known for their aromatic leaves and can be used in traditional medicine. The genus includes several species that are valued for their ornamental and medicinal properties.
